intro: Andromeda anastomosans, commonly known as the Florida flame flower, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its unique floral structure features fused petals and a distinctive, elongated corolla. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
